XCVI

THE PRIVATE OF THE BUFFS

LAST night, amonghis fellow roughs, He jested, quaffed, and swore3

A drunken private of the Buffs, Who never looked before.

To-day, beneath the foeman’s frown, He stands in Elgin’s place,

Ambassador from Britain's crown And type of all her race.

Poor, reckless, rude, low-born, untaught, Bewildered, and alone,

A heart, with English instinct fraught, He yet cau call his own.
